Item.Label: ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON active / ALL OFF active

Parameter.Label: Separation of association sending (key 1)

Item.Label: Map status to all devices in group 1
Map OFF status to all devices in group 1, Double click on key 1 will send ON to all devices in group 1, all dimmers set to prev.value
Map OFF status to all devices in group 1, Double click on key 1 will send ON to all devices in group 1, all dimmers set to 100%

Parameter.Help: Activate/Deactivate association sending for group 1 - Also see param #16

Parameter.Label: Control key #2 behaviour

Item.Label: Device status is not checked
Device status is checked

Parameter.Help: Key no.2 is not represented by any physical device - only devices in the association list. This functionality prevents of lack of reaction on pressing key no.2 through polling devices from association list one by one and checking their actual statuses.

Parameter.Label: Time of MANUALLY moving between the extreme dimming values
Time of AUTOMATIC moving between the extreme dimming values
Parameter.Help: Options for changing parameter 1-255 (10ms - 2,5s) - 0: this value disables the smooth change in light intensity. NOTE: value 0 is required for inductive and capacitive devices unsuitable for dimming (e.g. fluorescent lamps, motors, etc...)

Item.Label: Mono-stable input (button)
Bi-stable input (switch)
Disable double click
Enable double click
State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Parameter.Label: 3-way switch

Item.Label: Disable
Enable

Parameter.Help: The function of 3-way switch provides the option to double key no. 1. The dimmer may control two bi-stable push-buttons or an infinite number of mono-stable push-buttons. (default value 0)

Parameter.Label: Synchronizing light level for associated devices

Item.Label: Disable
Enable

Parameter.Help: The dimmer communicate the level to the associated devices. (default value 0)

Parameter.Label: Change [On-Off] bi-stable keys

Item.Label: Disable
Enable

Parameter.Help: This function allow user to change [On-Off] bi-stable keys (parameter no. 14) (default value 0)

Parameter.Label: Parm 20
Parameter.Help:
This function will enable decreasing the minimum level of the Dimmer by extending the control impulse.[100 - 170] By changing the minimem level, the user may completely dim LED bulbs. Not all LED bulbs available on the market have the dimmming option.
WARNING: Wrong setting of the function may cause incorrect operation of the Dimmer.

Item.Label: DEACTIVATION - no response to alarm frames
ALARM RELAY ON - relay will turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM RELAY OFF - relay will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - relay will turn ON and OFF periodically (see param.39)

Parameter.Label: ALARM FLASHING alarm time
Parameter.Help: Amount of time (ms) the device keeps on flashing after receipt of Alarm Frame
